alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 3:49PM MST until June 27 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Paria River and surrounding areas in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until midnight MST Monday. * At 348 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Paria River drainage to the west of the river, and over the Houserock Wash drainage. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Paria River. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Paria River. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lees Ferry, Grand Canyon National Park, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following slot canyons... Paria River upstream of Lees Ferry. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Rock Canyon, Paria River, Coyote Wash, and House Rock Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Get out of the Paria River slot canyon! Flood waters will flow down the Paria River, reaching the confluence with the Colorado River at Lees Ferry between 8 PM and midnight.
